headline.main: ROOSEVELT 'TRICK' CHARGED BY TAFT; Pepper, in Neutrality Debate, Taxes Isolationists With Causing Country's Peril ROOSEVELT 'TRICK' CHARGED BY TAFT

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 28 -- Charges that President Roosevelt in his Navy Day speech admitted publicly that he "tricked" the American people onto the road to war were made in the Senate today by Senator Taft of Ohio as foreign policy critics regained a modicum of hope that they might narrow the measure repealing all substantial provisions of the Neutrality Act of 1939.
abstract: Pepper charges isolationists with causing U S peril, Sen
